module.name: Beijing IO controller
module.description: With this VSCP module it is possible to control up to four digital outputs and read up to three optoisolated inputs.

firmware.description: Firmware version 1.0.0 for the Beijing module.

manual.description: Full manual for the Beijing module.

Input 0 status register
Read the state of input 0 in this register.\n 0 - is returned for inactive.\n 1 - is returned for active.\n
r
Input 1 status register
Read the state of input 1 in this register.\n 0 - is returned for inactive.\n 1 - is returned for active.\n
r
Input 2 status register
Read the state of input 2 in this register.\n 0 - is returned for inactive.\n 1 - is returned for active.\n
r
Reserved

r
Reserved
This register position is reserved for future use.
r
Output 0 status register
Writing a value to the output control register will activate/deactivate the output.\n 0 - The output is inactivated.\n 1 - The output is activated.\n Reading a value from the control register is read as a one if the relay is activated and a zero if the output is deactivated.\n When the pulse activation/deactivating is used the actual relay state is read.\n
rw
Off
Set output channel in is off state.
On
Set output channel in is on state.
Output 1 status register
Writing a value to the output control register will activate/deactivate the output.\n 0 - The output is inactivated.\n 1 - The output is activated.\n Reading a value from the control register is read as a one if the relay is activated and a zero if the output is deactivated.\n When the pulse activation/deactivating is used the actual relay state is read.\n
rw
Off
Set output channel in is off state.
On
Set output channel in is on state.
Output 2 status register
Writing a value to the output control register will activate/deactivate the output.\n 0 - The output is inactivated.\n 1 - The output is activated.\n Reading a value from the control register is read as a one if the relay is activated and a zero if the output is deactivated.\n When the pulse activation/deactivating is used the actual relay state is read.\n
rw
Off
Set output channel in is off state.
On
Set output channel in is on state.
Output 3 status register
Writing a value to the output control register will activate/deactivate the output.\n 0 - The output is inactivated.\n 1 - The output is activated.\n Reading a value from the control register is read as a one if the relay is activated and a zero if the output is deactivated.\n When the pulse activation/deactivating is used the actual relay state is read.\n
rw
Off
Set output channel in is off state.
On
Set output channel in is on state.

This register position is reserved for future use.
r

r
Reserved
This register position is reserved for future use.
r
Reserved
This register position is reserved for future use.
r
Output 0 control register
The output control bits enable/disable intelligent functionality:\n Bit 0 - Enable pulse.\n Bit 1 - If set: Alarm sent when protection timer triggers.\n Bit 2 - Protection timer enable.\n Bit 3 - Send On event when relay goes to active state.\n Bit 4 - Send Off event when relay goes to inactive state.\n Bit 5 - Reserved.\n Bit 6 - Reserved.\n Bit 7 - Enable output.\n
rw
Enable pulse Enable pulse on output
Protection alarm If set: Alarm sent when protection timer triggers.
Protection timer enable
If set: Protection timer is enabled and will deactivate output channel when the timer times out.
On event on activate enable
If set: An on event will be sent when the relay is turned on.
Off event on deactivate enable
If set: An off event will be sent when the relay is turned off.
Reserved
Reserved
Reserved
Reserved
Enable relay
Set this bit to make the output controllable.
Output 0 control register
The output control bits enable/disable intelligent functionality:\n Bit 0 - Enable pulse.\n Bit 1 - If set: Alarm sent when protection timer triggers.\n Bit 2 - Protection timer enable.\n Bit 3 - Send On event when relay goes to active state.\n Bit 4 - Send Off event when relay goes to inactive state.\n Bit 5 - Reserved.\n Bit 6 - Reserved.\n Bit 7 - Enable output.\n
rw

On event on activate enable
If set: An on event will be sent when the relay is turned on.
Off event on deactivate enable
If set: An off event will be sent when the relay is turned off.

r
Input 0 control register
The input control bits enable/disable intelligent functionality:\n Bit 0 - Send On/TurnOn event when input goes to active state.\n Bit 1 - Send Off/TurnOff event when input goes to inactive state.\n Bit 2 - 0 = Send On/off events. 1=Send turnon/turnoff events (if activated).\n Bit 3 - Alarm event sent if input goes low.\n Bit 4 - Alarm event sent if input goes high.\n Bit 5 - Reserved.\n Bit 6 - Activate debounce\n Bit 7 - Enable input.\n
rw
Activate ON/TURNON-event Send On/TurnOn event when input goes to active state.
Activate OFF/TURNOFF-event Send Off/TurnOff event when input goes to inactive state.
State event select.
Set to send On/off events. Set to one to send turnon/turnoff events (if activated).
Alarm on low
An alarm event is sent if input goes low.
Alarm on high
An alarm event is sent if input goes high.
Reserved
Reserved
Activate debounce
Debounce functionality is activated
Enable input
Set this bit to make the input active.
Input 1 control register
The input control bits enable/disable intelligent functionality:\n Bit 0 - Send On/TurnOn event when input goes to active state.\n Bit 1 - Send Off/TurnOff event when input goes to inactive state.\n Bit 2 - 0 = Send On/off events. 1=Send turnon/turnoff events (if activated).\n Bit 3 - Alarm event sent if input goes low.\n Bit 4 - Alarm event sent if input goes high.\n Bit 5 - Reserved.\n Bit 6 - Activate debounce\n Bit 7 - Enable input.\n
rw
Activate ON/TURNON-event Send On/TurnOn event when input goes to active state.
Activate OFF/TURNOFF-event Send Off/TurnOff event when input goes to inactive state.
State event select.
Set to send On/off events. Set to one to send turnon/turnoff events (if activated).
Alarm on low
An alarm event is sent if input goes low.
Alarm on high

Reserved
Reserved
Activate debounce
Debounce functionality is activated
Enable input
Set this bit to make the input active.

rw
Activate ON/TURNON-event Send On/TurnOn event when input goes to active state.
Activate OFF/TURNOFF-event Send Off/TurnOff event when input goes to inactive state.

Set to send On/off events. Set to one to send turnon/turnoff events (if activated).

Alarm on high

Enable input
Set this bit to make the input active.

r

This register position is reserved for future use.
r
Debounce time
Debounce time in milliseconds * 10. That is 1=10 ms, 2=20 ms and so on.
rw
Module Control register
It is possible to control general module behaviour in this register.\n Bit 0 - Send On/TurnOn event when input goes to active state.\n Bit 1 - Reserved.\n Bit 2 - Reserved.\n Bit 3 - Reserved.\n Bit 4 - Reserved.\n Bit 5 - Reserved.\n Bit 6 - Reserved.\n Bit 7 - Reserved.\n
rw
Input stream sample time
This is the time in seconds between input stream samples. Set to zero to disable.\n CLASS1.DATA is sent with data coding=0(bits), unit=0, sensor=0 for the inputs/outputs as set here. First byte is outputs, second byte is inputs.
rw
/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// // Register Page 1 - Timing ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
// * * * Pulse time * * *
Output pulse time register for output 0 MSB
This is the pulse time for the each output expressed in seconds. This can be used to make an output turn on and off with a certain preset interval. The min pulse time is 1 second and the max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. Set to zero (default) for no pulse time i.e. the output will be steady on/off.\n To start a pulse sequence first write the pulse time to this register and then write 2 to the output status register to start the output. The pulse train is terminated by writing on or off (1 or 0) to the output status register.\n
rw
Output pulse time register for output 0 LSB
This is the pulse time for the each output expressed in seconds. This can be used to make an output turn on and off with a certain preset interval. The min pulse time is 1 second and the max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. Set to zero (default) for no pulse time i.e. the output will be steady on/off.\n To start a pulse sequence first write the pulse time to this register and then write 2 to the output status register to start the output. The pulse train is terminated by writing on or off (1 or 0) to the output status register.\n
rw

The min pulse time is 1 second and the max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. Set to zero (default) for no pulse time i.e. the output will be steady on/off.\n To start a pulse sequence first write the pulse time to this register and then write 2 to the output status register to start the output. The pulse train is terminated by writing on or off (1 or 0) to the output status register.\n
rw

// * * * Output protection * * *
Output protection time register for output 0 MSB
This is the output protection time. A output will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed.\n Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours.\n The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the relay.
rw
Output protection time register for output 0 LSB
This is the output protection time. A output will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed.\n Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours.\n The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the relay.
rw
Output protection time register for output 1 MSB
This is the output protection time. A output will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed.\n Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours.\n The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the relay.
rw

This is the output protection time. A output will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed.\n Set to zero to disable (default). rw
Output protection time register for output 3 LSB
This is the output protection time. A output will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed.\n Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours.\n The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the relay.

/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// // Register Page 2 - Decision Matrix ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
Decision matrix row 1: Oaddr
Row 1 of decision matrix. Originating address. Set to nickname for node that should trigger action. Oaddr is the originating address. We are only interested in messages from the node given here. 0×00 is segment controller and 0xff is a node without a nickname. If bit 6 of flags is set oaddr will not be checked and events from all nodes will be accepted.
rw
Decision matrix row 1: flags
Row 1 of decision matrix. Flags. Set selection behaviour.\n The enable bit can be used to disable a decion matrix row while it is edited.\n The zone and use subzone bits can be activated to have a check on the zone/subzone information of an event. That is the zone/subzone of the machine must match the one of the event to trigger the DM row.\n
rw
Class filter bit 8 Defines the ninth bit of the class filter.
Class mask bit 8 Defines the ninth bit of the class mask.
Reserved bit This bit is not used.
Subzone match If set to one subzone should be matched to trigger DM entry action.
Zone match If set to one zone should be matched to trigger DM entry action.
Hardcoded If set to one the originating address should be hardcoded to trigger DM entry action.
Check Originating address If set to one the originating address should be checked and match to trigger DM entry action.
Enable Enable (1) or disable (0)the decison matrix row.
Decision matrix row 1: Class mask (low eight bits)
The lowest eight bits of the class mask that defines the events that should trigger the action of thsi decision matrix row.\n Bit 8 of the class mask is stored in bit 1 of the flag byte.
rw
Decision matrix row 1: Class filter (low eight bits)
The lowest eight bits of the class filter that defines the events that should trigger the action of thsi decision matrix row.\n Bit 8 of the class filter is stored in bit 1 of the flag byte.
rw
Decision matrix row 1: Type mask
Type mask that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.
rw
Decision matrix row 1: Type filter
Type filter that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.
rw
Decision matrix row 1: Action
This is the action or operation that should be performed if the filtering is satisfied. Only action code 0×00 is predefined and means No-Operation. All other codes are application specific and typical application defined codes could do measurement, send predefined event etc.
rw
Decision matrix row 1: Action parameter
A numeric action parameter can be set and its meaning is application specific.
rw
Decision matrix row 2: Oaddr
Row 1 of decision matrix. Originating address. Set to nickname for node that should trigger action. Oaddr is the originating address. We are only interested in messages from the node given here. 0×00 is segment controller and 0xff is a node without a nickname. If bit 6 of flags is set oaddr will not be checked and events from all nodes will be accepted.
rw

That is the zone/subzone of the machine must match the one of the event to trigger the DM row.\n

Decision matrix row 5: flags
Row 1 of decision matrix. Flags. Set selection behaviour.\n The enable bit can be used to disable a decion matrix row while it is edited.\n The zone and use subzone bits can be activated to have a check on the zone/subzone information of an event. That is the zone/subzone of the machine must match the one of the event to trigger the DM row.\n
rw
Class filter bit 8 Defines the ninth bit of the class filter.
Class mask bit 8 Defines the ninth bit of the class mask.
Reserved bit This bit is not used.
Subzone match If set to one subzone should be matched to trigger DM entry action.
Zone match If set to one zone should be matched to trigger DM entry action.
Hardcoded If set to one the originating address should be hardcoded to trigger DM entry action.
Check Originating address If set to one the originating address should be checked and match to trigger DM entry action.
Enable Enable (1) or disable (0)the decison matrix row.
Decision matrix row 5: Class mask (low eight bits)
The lowest eight bits of the class mask that defines the events that should trigger the action of thsi decision matrix row.\n Bit 8 of the class mask is stored in bit 1 of the flag byte.
rw
Decision matrix row 5: Class filter (low eight bits)
The lowest eight bits of the class filter that defines the events that should trigger the action of thsi decision matrix row.\n Bit 8 of the class filter is stored in bit 1 of the flag byte.
rw
Decision matrix row 5: Type mask
Type mask that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.
rw
Decision matrix row 5: Type filter
Type filter that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.
rw
Decision matrix row 5: Action
This is the action or operation that should be performed if the filtering is satisfied. Only action code 0×00 is predefined and means No-Operation. All other codes are application specific and typical application defined codes could do measurement, send predefined event etc.
rw
Decision matrix row 5: Action parameter
A numeric action parameter can be set and its meaning is application specific.
rw
Decision matrix row 6: Oaddr
Row 1 of decision matrix. Originating address. Set to nickname for node that should trigger action. Oaddr is the originating address. We are only interested in messages from the node given here. 0×00 is segment controller and 0xff is a node without a nickname. If bit 6 of flags is set oaddr will not be checked and events from all nodes will be accepted.
rw
Decision matrix row 6: flags
Row 1 of decision matrix. Flags. Set selection behaviour.\n The enable bit can be used to disable a decion matrix row while it is edited.\n The zone and use subzone bits can be activated to have a check on the zone/subzone information of an event. That is the zone/subzone of the machine must match the one of the event to trigger the DM row.\n
rw
Class filter bit 8 Defines the ninth bit of the class filter.
Class mask bit 8 Defines the ninth bit of the class mask.
Reserved bit This bit is not used.
Subzone match If set to one subzone should be matched to trigger DM entry action.
Zone match If set to one zone should be matched to trigger DM entry action.
Hardcoded If set to one the originating address should be hardcoded to trigger DM entry action.
Check Originating address If set to one the originating address should be checked and match to trigger DM entry action.
Enable Enable (1) or disable (0)the decison matrix row.
Decision matrix row 6: Class mask (low eight bits)
The lowest eight bits of the class mask that defines the events that should trigger the action of thsi decision matrix row.\n Bit 8 of the class mask is stored in bit 1 of the flag byte.
rw
Decision matrix row 6: Class filter (low eight bits)
The lowest eight bits of the class filter that defines the events that should trigger the action of thsi decision matrix row.\n Bit 8 of the class filter is stored in bit 1 of the flag byte.
rw
Decision matrix row 6: Type mask
Type mask that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.
rw
Decision matrix row 6: Type filter
Type filter that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.
rw
Decision matrix row 6: Action
This is the action or operation that should be performed if the filtering is satisfied. Only action code 0×00 is predefined and means No-Operation. All other codes are application specific and typical application defined codes could do measurement, send predefined event etc.
rw
Decision matrix row 6: Action parameter
A numeric action parameter can be set and its meaning is application specific.
rw

We are only interested in messages from the node given here. 0×00 is segment controller and 0xff is a node without a nickname. If bit 6 of flags is set oaddr will not be checked and events from all nodes will be accepted.

abstraction.name: Output pulse time register for output 0
abstraction.description:
This is the pulse time for output 0 expressed in seconds. It can be used to have an output turn on and off with a certain preset interval. The min pulse time is 1 second and the max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. Set to zero (default) for no pulse time i.e. the output will be steady on/off.

 To start a pulse sequence first write the pulse time to this register and then write to output status register to start the output sequence. The pulse train is terminated by writing on or off (1 or 0) to the output status register.

abstraction.name: Output pulse time register for output 1
abstraction.description:
This is the pulse time for output 1 expressed in seconds. It can be used to have an output turn on and off with a certain preset interval. The min pulse time is 1 second and the max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. Set to zero (default) for no pulse time i.e. the output will be steady on/off.

 To start a pulse sequence first write the pulse time to this register and then write to output status register to start the output sequence. The pulse train is terminated by writing on or off (1 or 0) to the output status register.

abstraction.name: Output pulse time register for output 2
abstraction.description:
This is the pulse time for output 2 expressed in seconds. It can be used to have an output turn on and off with a certain preset interval. The min pulse time is 1 second and the max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. Set to zero (default) for no pulse time i.e. the output will be steady on/off.

 To start a pulse sequence first write the pulse time to this register and then write to output status register to start the output sequence. The pulse train is terminated by writing on or off (1 or 0) to the output status register.

abstraction.name: Output pulse time register for output 3
abstraction.description:
This is the pulse time for output 3 expressed in seconds. It can be used to have an output turn on and off with a certain preset interval. The min pulse time is 1 second and the max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. Set to zero (default) for no pulse time i.e. the output will be steady on/off.

 To start a pulse sequence first write the pulse time to this register and then write to output status register to start the output sequence. The pulse train is terminated by writing on or off (1 or 0) to the output status register.

abstraction.name: Output protection time register output 0
abstraction.description:
This is the output protection time. A output will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed.

 Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours.

 The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the output.

abstraction.name: Output protection time register output 0
abstraction.description:
This is the output protection time. A output will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed.

 Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours.

 The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the output.

abstraction.name: Output protection time register output 0
abstraction.description:
This is the output protection time. A output will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed.

 Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours.

 The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the output.

abstraction.name: Output protection time register output 0
abstraction.description:
This is the output protection time. A output will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed.

 Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours.

 The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the output.

bit.name: Low alarm
bit.description: An input bit has gone low and the alarm condition for it is enabled.

bit.name: High alarms
bit.description: An input bit has gone high and the alarm condition for it is enabled.

action.name: Activate outputs(s)
action.description: Activate outputs(s) given by argument. The argument is a bit array where bit 0 is output 0 and so on.\n

param.name: Bit-array for outputs to activate
param.description: A bit-array where the first bit represents output zero and so on.

bit.name: Output 0
bit.description: Set to one to activate output 0.

bit.name: Output 1
bit.description: Set to one to activate output 1.

bit.name: Output 2
bit.description: Set to one to activate output 2.

bit.name: Output 3
bit.description: Set to one to activate output 3.

action.name: Deactivate outputs(s)
action.description: Deactivate outputs(s) given by argument. The argument is a bit array where bit 0 is output 0 and so on.\n

param.name: Bit-array for outputs
param.description: A bit-array where the first bit represents output zero and so on.

bit.name: Output 0
bit.description: Set to one to deactivate output 0.

bit.name: Output 1
bit.description: Set to one to deactivate output 1.

bit.name: Output 2
bit.description: Set to one to deactivate output 2.

bit.name: Output 3
bit.description: Set to one to deactivate output 3.

action.name: Set outputs(s)
action.description: Set outputs(s) given by argument. The argument is a bit array where bit 0 is output 0 and so on.\n

param.name: Bit-array for outputs
param.description: A bit-array where the first bit represents output zero and so on. A bit set to zero on a position will deactivate that output and a bit set to one on a position will activate that position.

bit.name: Output 0
bit.description: Set to one to activate output 0. Set to zero to deactivate output 0.

bit.name: Output 1
bit.description: Set to one to activate output 0. Set to zero to deactivate output 0.

bit.name: Output 2
bit.description: Set to one to activate output 0. Set to zero to deactivate output 0.

bit.name: Output 3
bit.description: Set to one to activate output 0. Set to zero to deactivate output 0.

action.name: Pulse output(s)
action.description: Pulse output(s) given by argument. The argument is a bit array where bit 0 is output 0 and so on.\n

param.name: Bit-array for outputs
param.description: A bit-array where the first bit represents output zero and so on.

bit.name: Output 0
bit.description: Set to one to pulse output 0.

bit.name: Output 1
bit.description: Set to one to pulse output 1.

bit.name: Output 2
bit.description: Set to one to pulse output 2.

bit.name: Output 3
bit.description: Set to one to pulse output 3.

action.name: Toggle outputs(s)
action.description: Toggle outputs(s) given by argument. The argument is a bit-array where bit 0 is output 0 and so on.\n

param.name: Bit-array for outputs
param.description: A bit-array where the first bit represents output zero and so on.

bit.name: Output 0
bit.description: Set to one to toggle output 0

bit.name: Output 1
bit.description: Set to one to toggle output 1

bit.name: Output 2
bit.description: Set to one to toggle output 2

bit.name: Output 3
bit.description: Set to one to toggle output 3

action.name: Send status for output(s)
action.description: Send status for output(s) given by argument. The argument is a bit-array where bit 0 is output 0 and so on.\n

param.name: Bit-array for outputs
param.description: A bit-array where the first bit represents output 0 and so on.

bit.name: Output 0
bit.description: Set to one to send status for output 0.

bit.name: Output 1
bit.description: Set to one to send status for output 1.

bit.name: Output 2
bit.description: Set to one to send status for output 2.

bit.name: Output 3
bit.description: Set to one to send status for output 3.

action.name: Send status for input(s)
action.description: Send status for input(s) given by argument. The argument is a bit-array where bit 0 is input 0 and so on.\n

param.name: Bit-array for inputs
param.description: A bit-array where the first bit represents input 0 and so on.

bit.name: Input 0
bit.description: Set to one to send status for input 0.

bit.name: Input 1
bit.description: Set to one to send status for input 1.

bit.name: Input 2
bit.description: Set to one to send status for input 2.

action.name: Disable Outputs(s)
action.description: Disable outputs(s) given by argument. The argument is a bit-array where bit 0 is output 0 and so on.\n

param.name: Bit-array for outputs
param.description: A bit-array where the first bit represents output zero and so on.

bit.name: Output 0
bit.description: Set to one to disable output 0.

bit.name: Output 1
bit.description: Set to one to disable output 1.

bit.name: Output 2
bit.description: Set to one to disable output 2.

bit.name: Output 3
bit.description: Set to one to disable output 3.

action.name: Enable Outputs(s)
action.description: Enable outputs(s) given by argument. The argument is a bit-array where bit 0 is output 0 and so on.\n

param.name: Bit-array for outputs
param.description: A bit-array where the first bit represents output zero and so on.

bit.name: Output 0
bit.description: Set to one to enable output 0.

bit.name: Output 1
bit.description: Set to one to enable output 1.

bit.name: Output 2
bit.description: Set to one to enable output 2.

bit.name: Output 3
bit.description: Set to one to enable output 3.

action.name: Disable Inputs(s)
action.description: Disable inputs(s) given by argument. The argument is a bit-array where bit 0 is input 0 and so on.\n

param.name: Bit-array for inputs
param.description: A bit-array where the first bit represents input zero and so on.

bit.name: Input 0
bit.description: Set to one to disable input 0.

bit.name: Input 1
bit.description: Set to one to disable input 1.

bit.name: Input 2
bit.description: Set to one to disable input 2.

action.name: Enable input(s)
action.description: Enable input(s) given by argument. The argument is a bit-array where bit 0 is input 0 and so on.\n

param.name: Bit-array for outputs
param.description: A bit-array where the first bit represents input zero and so on.

bit.name: Input 0
bit.description: Set to one to enable input 0.

bit.name: Input 1
bit.description: Set to one to enable input 1.

bit.name: Input 2
bit.description: Set to one to enable input 2.

event.name: On Event
event.description: An output has been set in its ON position.

data.name: Index
data.description: Is set to n indicating relay n (0-3)

data.name: Zone
data.description: Is set to the zone for the module.

data.name: Subzone
data.description: Is set to the sub zone for the output or if it is zero to the sub zone for the module.

event.name: Off Event
event.description: An output has been set in its OFF position.

data.name: Index
data.description: Set to n indicating output n (0-3)

data.name: Zone
data.description: Is set to the zone for the module.

data.name: Subzone
data.description: Is set to the sub zone for the output or if it is zero to the sub zone for the module.

event.name: TurnOn Event
event.description: An input has gone to its ON position.

data.name: Index
data.description: Set to n indicating input n (0-3)

data.name: Zone
data.description: Is set to the zone for the module.

data.name: Subzone
data.description: Is set to the sub zone for the input or if it is zero to the sub zone for the module.

event.name: TurnOff Event
event.description: An input has gone to its OFF position.

data.name: Index
data.description: Set to n indicating input n (0-3)

data.name: Zone
data.description: Is set to the zone for the module.

data.name: Subzone
data.description: Is set to the sub zone for the input or if it is zero to the sub zone for the module.

event.name: I/O Data event
event.description: Input/Output data steam event sent on regular intervals if activated.

data.name: Datacoding
data.description: Set to zero for bit coding, unit=0, sensor=0.

data.name: Outputs states
data.description: State for outputs. Bit 0 is output 0 and so on.

data.name: Input states
data.description: State for inputs. Bit 0 is input 0 and so on.
